snippet: The development, if confirmed, represents the second strategic setback for President Bashar al-Assad’s government this week.
abstract: Syrian insurgents seize control of Al Jarrah airfield in Aleppo Province and capture usable warplanes for first time in nearly two-year-old conflict; seizure comes day after insurgents took control of Syria's largest hydroelectric dam.

byline.original: By HWAIDA SAAD and RICK GLADSTONE
byline.contributor: Hwaida Saad reported from Beirut, and Rick Gladstone from New York. Hania Mourtada and Anne Barnard contributed reporting from Beirut.

lead_paragraph: The development, if confirmed, represents the second strategic setback for President Bashar al-Assad’s government this week.

headline.seo: Syrian Rebels Claim to Have Seized Military Airfield and Warplanes
headline.main: Syrian Rebels Say They Have Seized a Military Airfield and Its Warplanes
headline.print_headline: Syrian Rebels Say They Have Seized a Military Airfield and Its Warplanes
